item.title: Dumped wood, illegal sign, 13th June
item.description:
Various oroblems. Dumped wood around the side of Cutty Sharp Barbers. Always rubbish dumped here. Sign placed on lamppost three quarters of the way up. Dumped rubbish constantly in alley where access leads to behind the shops.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Grove, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The occupants at number 17 have had all of this rubbish on the footpath since Tuesday 10th June., 13th June
item.description:
The occupants at number 17 have had all of this rubbish on the footpath since Tuesday 10th June. This is causing an obstruction to pedestrians and is dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rolleston Avenue, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident's plants obstructing footpath, 13th June
item.description:
No 2 Crouch Croft sits on the junction with William Barefoot Drive. The plants on its boundary are overgrown and obstruct the pavement significantly. It is near impossible to walk past without having to duck underneath branches or step into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crouch Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Outside 101 George Lane - has been there 3 weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Lane, Hither Green, London

item.title: Young tree needs re-staking or it will fall, 13th June
item.description:
The strapping and stakes have broken/become dislodged and the tree is leaning at a precarious angle. While this is probably not dangerous to the public, the tree will certainly not survive without being looked at in the very near future. This would be a shame and a waste as it was only planted within the last couple of years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynwood Grove, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Visibility issues at pedestrian crossing, 13th June
item.description:
The base of the tree needs pruning back as at present the visibility for pedestrians, and particularly children wanting to cross Burnt Ash Lane is very restricted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Too many limes, 13th June
item.description:
Every weekend it’s the same. There are 100s of limes at this station and it’s overflowing onto both the path and the road. Rather than getting one guy to come and periodically take some away why not either limit the amount there or open more stations

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westgate Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ask dieback, 13th June
item.description:
